decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells and bouncing their threats while setting up for powerful late-game plays with Polymorph','','');">Mass Polymorph, Polymorph, and Proteus Staff to cheat in big Eldrazi threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck runs a high number of counterspells and card draw spells to maintain control over the game and protect its win conditions. Using Baral, Chief of Compliance's ability to reduce the cost of instants and sorceries, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and overwhelm them with powerful spells while disrupting their game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing a wide variety of creature threats and versatile spells to apply pressure on the opponent quickly and efficiently. With access to powerful cards like Craterhoof Behemoth, True-Name Nemesis, and Stoneforge Mystic, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with large creatures and disruptive spells. The deck also includes powerful utility creatures like Glen Elendra Archmage and Reclamation Sage to provide additional disruption and protection. Additionally, the deck includes a strong mana base with a variety of dual lands and mana dorks to ensure consistent and fast mana development. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive and proactive, putting the opponent on the back foot and forcing them to react to its threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures like Geist of Saint Traft. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while protecting its own threats. The deck includes a variety of efficient spells to counter opponent's plays, such as Force of Will, Mana Leak, and Spell Pierce. It also includes removal spells like Path to Exile and Swords to Plowshares to deal with opposing threats. Additionally, the deck has ways to protect its key creatures and enhance them with equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Steel of the Godhead. Overall, the deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast opponents through careful resource management and strategic gameplay.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful removal spells. Bruse Tarl, Boorish Herder serves as the commander, providing valuable lifelink and double strike abilities to boost the deck's aggro strategy. The deck features a mix of efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminate, as well as powerful creatures like Goblin Guide and Queen Marchesa. Additionally, the deck includes utility cards like Liliana of the Veil and Stoneforge Mystic to provide card advantage and search for key equipment, such as Umezawa's Jitte. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and control the board through removal and efficient creature threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful planeswalkers. It uses Breya, Etherium Shaper as the commander to generate value and maintain control over the game. By utilizing a mixture of artifact synergies and versatile spells, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up its own resources. Through a combination of card advantage engines, tutor effects, and powerful win conditions like Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek, the deck is able to outvalue opponents while maintaining strong control over the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and provide consistency in its control elements.

This deck focuses on maximizing the potential of Vial Smasher the Fierce by including a wide range of instant-speed spells with varying effects. The key strategy revolves around controlling the board through counterspells and removal while also dealing damage to opponents with Vial Smasher's ability. The deck includes a mix of versatile instant spells, efficient removal, and counterspells to disrupt opponents and protect your own game plan. The mana base is designed to provide the necessary colors to cast spells efficiently and consistently. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure on opponents while maintaining control of the battlefield, ultimately securing victory through a combination of damage and strategic spellcasting.

The main theme of this deck is to apply aggressive pressure on the opponent using a combination of efficient creatures, disruptive spells, and powerful equipment. The deck aims to control the board while also dealing direct damage to the opponent, utilizing Yidris, Maelstrom Wielder as the commander. The inclusion of versatile cards like Demonic Tutor and Snapcaster Mage allows for flexibility in adapting to different situations. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency in casting spells of different colors. Overall, the deck focuses on a proactive playstyle that aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently, while also having the ability to answer threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells while utilizing Zurgo Bellstriker as the commander. The deck is filled with low-cost creatures and efficient burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent and control the board. With a high density of direct damage spells and creatures with haste, the goal is to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Sulfuric Vortex and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle ensures that the opponent will have a hard time stabilizing or gaining life, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive strategy and close out the game quickly.
